usefulItems: 5 layer cake tins (15 cm), wire racks, skewer, frying pan, serving plate or cake stand, oven, hob
title: Almond and Matcha Cake

ingredients.content: 3 tsp matcha green tea powder, plus extra for dusting
50 g white chocolate, small pieces or callets

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 220°C and grease 5 layer cake tins (Ø 15 cm).
<b>Insert butterfly whisk<b>. Place egg whites and cream of tartar in mixing bowl then, without measuring cup, whisk <b>1 min 30 sec/speed 4<b>.
Add granulated sugar and whisk <b>10 sec/speed 4<b>. <b>Remove butterfly whisk<b> then transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place whole eggs, icing sugar and almonds in mixing bowl then mix <b>1 min/speed 4<b>.
Add flour, matcha tea powder and ⅓ whisked egg white mixture then mix <b>10 sec/speed 3<b>.
Add remaining egg white mixture and mix <b>15 sec/speed 2.5<b>. Finish mixing by hand with spatula.

Divide evenly between prepared tins. Bake for 6-8 minutes (220°C) until a skewer inserted in centre comes out clean. Loosen with a knife then remove to wire racks to cool. Meanwhile, clean mixing bowl and make buttercream.
Place white chocolate in mixing bowl and chop <b>5 sec/speed 8<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then melt <b>1 min 30 sec/60°C/speed 0.5<b>.
Add butter, icing sugar and vanilla extract then beat <b>30 sec/speed 3.5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then beat again <b>30 sec/speed 3.5<b>. Set aside.
Toast almonds in a frying pan over a medium heat for a few minutes until lightly browned then set aside to cool.

Place a sponge layer on a serving plate and spread with 2 Tbsp buttercream. Place another sponge on top then repeat with remaining buttercream and sponges. Ice final layer and sides of cake with buttercream.
Sprinkle reserved toasted almonds on top then dust with matcha powder before serving.
